attributes.action: Tighten banking regulations to prevent crippling overdraft fee increases
attributes.additional_details:
In 2008, the government and UK taxpayer bailed out much of the banking sector.

Since then, poorer people have paid further.

Many banks enjoyed revenue from confusing, unfair charges.

Following recommendations to stop this, a newer "Xp per day" daily fee structure appears to be the way forward.

Under this system, the revenue may not be lost.

The most financially vulnerable pay the most and by some margin.

There is no desire to offer a "leg up", more a "punishment" for those most in debt.
attributes.background:
In recent years, campaigns / complaints regarding unfair overdraft charges have led to recommendations to simplify overdraft charging

Since then, some banks have "simplified" their fees. However this isn't a victory for the people

The fees are being picked up by the most financially vulnerable

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action. 

We understand that you're concerned about overdraft charges, but we're not sure exactly what changes you'd like to see. 

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.
